page.title: 06UPHILL BEACH
page.content: UPHILL BEACH IS A LANG STRECH OF SAND FROM WHICH A VEIW OF BLACKROCK, BREAN DOWN AND WESTON CAN BE SEEN. AT THE LOW TIDE LEVEL THERE IS A SEWAGE OUTFALL FROM WESTON-A LINE OF UNTREATED SEWAGE WHICH PROVIDES AN INTERESTING FEEDING SITE SUITABLE FOR THE STUDY OF SEA BIRDS.FURTHER UP THE BEACH AT THE TOP OF THE TIDE LEVEL, NUMEROUS BIVALVE SHELLS CAN BE FOUND IN THE SAND ALONGSIDE BLADDER WRACK SEAWEED AND OTHER DEBRIS WASHED IN BY TIDE. STATIONED AT THE ESTVARY OF THE RIVER AXE ARE A COLLECTION OF BOATS,A FEW FOR PLEASURE ALTHOUGH THE MAGORITY BEING USED FOR FISHING.A FERRY IS AVAILABLE TO CARRY TOURIST ACROSS THE STRECH OF WATER TO BREANDOWN. THE BEACH IS IDEAL FOR BEACH FISHING,PARTICULARLY DEAD LINE FISHING OF WHICH FLAT FISH ARE THE MAIN CATCH.
